basics.name: Robin Bretin
basics.label: PhD, Cognitive Engineer
basics.summary: With a background in both computer science and applied cognitive psychology, I am a versatile 'Swiss army knife' researcher, equally at ease with technical and theoretical work in Human-Robot and Human-Computer Interaction. My expertise lies in Extended Reality, proxemic behaviors, and Human-Drone Interaction—the core pillars of my thesis project. A lifelong learner driven by the question 'but why?', I am passionate about tackling unresolved problems through innovative approaches—because the answers are out there, waiting to be uncovered.

references.name: Dr. Mohamed Khamis
references.reference: Robin is truly an exceptional researcher and I highly recommend them for any position where innovative thinking, collaborative skills, and research excellence are valued! I would have hired him if I had vacant positions!

work.name: University of Glasgow, Glasgow, United Kingdom
work.summary: Performed various research activities throughout my thesis. Supervised my Dr. Mohammed Khamis (University of Glasgow) and Prof. Dr. Emily Cross (ETH Zurich)
highlights: Designed and conducted in-person and VR-based user studies, employing Unity, C#, and Python drone programming.
Quantitative and qualitative analysis of various data format using R.
Academic writing (e.g., posters, journal and conference papers) leading to publications in top-tier peer-reviewed journals and conferences.
Presented published work at international conferences, including CHI and INTERACT.
Reviewed papers for CHI, HRI, CSCW, THRI, and ISMAR.
Served as 1AC for CHI LBW track.

work.name: Chalmers University of Technology, Goteborg, Sweden
work.summary: Led a project on Drones' Social Cues impact on proxemics, in collaboration with local researchers including Dr. Mohammad Obaid.

work.name: SNCF/Human Design Group, Paris, France
work.summary: Developed a methodology to assess human reliability in train conductor functions for the Autonomous Train project.
highlights: Collaborated with train conductors and presented findings to clients.

work.name: Armed Forces Biomedical Research Institute (IRBA), Brétigny-sur-Orge, France
work.summary: Conducted ergonomic inspections of the VICTEAMS VR prototype.
highlights: Investigated gaze-based interaction designs and collected data in VR environments.
Contributed to improving virtual environments for team-based training scenarios.

education.institution: University of Glasgow, Social AI CDT
education.summary: Thesis titled 'Beyond Boundaries: Unveiling Human-Drone Proxemic Dynamics Using Virtual Reality.'
Specialized in applied cognitive psychology to technology usage (cognitive engineering), with training in human factors, programming, artificial intelligence, and human-computer interaction.
Lectures on Big Data, Game Design and 3D modeling during a culturally enriching exchange program.
Intensive foundational studies preparing for competitive entrance exams to French Grandes Écoles.

education.area: Exact Sciences - Life and Earth Sciences (S-SVT)
education.summary: Graduated with highest honors (Mention Très Bien).
